results.title: Berlin: symphony of a great city
results.brief_description: A documentary by Walther Ruttman, dealing with a day in the life of a city and heavily influenced by Eisenstein’s ‘Potemkin’. Ruttman emphasized visual rhythms in his cutting and strove to give his films a symphonic organization and as such the film was widely influential to other filmmakers showing how the motifs of everyday life could be patterned thematically. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Gertie the dinosaur
results.brief_description: Gertie the dinosaur the first cartoon of any importance, was produced by Winsor McCay, a cartoonist for the New York American. It features a live-action frame, and approximately ten thousand individual drawings were used for the animation.

results.title: New life - new ways
results.brief_description: Examines the potential loneliness and isolation faced by migrant women coming to live in urban Australia. Highlights the many inadequacies of Australian support systems to cope with the special problems of non-English speaking migrant women. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Muchmore's marvellous machine
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Mathematics for elementary school students: whole numbers”.
Introduces children to the mathematical whole number concept of the decimal system. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Be prepared
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the necessity for preparation in a group information session. Steve arrives late and is ill-prepared for his demonstration of a new slogan. His equipment fails, he is interrupted by workmen and he loses his audience. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Well, if you ask me
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Discussion starter looking at the difficulties of eliciting opinions from within a group. Two executives are clear in their objections to the location of a new plant. However, once inside the boardroom they say nothing and the proposal is passed without objection. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Any questions?
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Victorian Film Corporation and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the problems of generating group discussions. After completing a complicated explanation, a trainer asks questions of the group. In his despair at failing to elicit questions he jumps out the window.

results.title: Briefing
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Discussion starter looking at the problem of an individual receiving information from a group. Three executives are briefing a new designer and digress to such an extent that at the end of the briefing the designer still has to ask what the product was. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Decision makers
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Looks at the problem of small group decision-making. An inadequately briefed syndicate group wastes time deciding what it is supposed to be discussing. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
